title: eloniav2
author: eloniav2
content: Hi everyone, wanna share my experience that I had on coinbase. I usually deposit here and send to FreeBitco or other wallets. Today, happened something funny, my account got limited after I buyed some ETH. So wasn't able to Send & Sell anymore. The support, make me lose also 4 hours, asking me to change hundred times the browsers.Then , at the end, the guy from the support said me , is because the system detect something suspicious. I always login from same network (from here), in any case, I understand that, so I resend a selfie & front/back of my ID card. After the confirm of it went good, I wasn't still able to Send & Sell. So then I go to "Disable account" (to receive my eth) and close this weird service. Again here, it says I've to contact the support. Contacted, and instead helping me with Disabling the account, he went straight back to the first ticket I had.So what I should say, if u wanna see someone joking with u're coins, just use Coinbase. Now I bought a one-way flight to binance, good luck guys, just wanna share a way that coinbase block our funds for several time for no reason. Have a nice day everyone!

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I think the reason why your Coinbase account become limited is due to their gambling policy. Look freebitco.in is a gambling site if you made some transaction using Coinbase to send or receive from freebitco.in then you've already violated their policy.Also, coinbase is not a good place to buy coins their service is pretty strict compared to Binance based on my experience.Anyway, how do you buy ETH did you use coins or FIAT?If you paid it with FIAT through a bank you can maybe able to dispute the transaction.

comments.body: Quote from: eloniav2 on September 09, 2023, 04:55:45 PMYes I understand, I think this too. So all I know so far, is that I just give up that funds, contacted my bank and explained how they block my funds hope to get refunded back by them.The support team responded with inaccurate information, but from what I mentioned, the reason is the gambling site. I do not think that binance has a similar policy, but in any case, and to avoid this happening in the future, try to break the link between the last withdrawal/deposit process and your wallet with several intermediate wallets, meaning that you send money to several wallets you manage them Before depositing or withdrawing, it is true that twill cost you more fees but it is rare for these sites to go through a chain analysis of longer than 3 transactions. You can also use mixing services.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Coinbase being US based and following US rules and regulations can and will do things to your account (restrict / ask for more info / close) then other exchanges.The upside, is that they do follow a lot more rules and regulations so unlike others (including the one you mentioned) if they do kick you off their platform you will get your coins back without too much hassle. There will be a delay, but you will get them. The other side is the rules are many and not well documented so you never know where you might trip one.-Dave
